member.name: MEM_ADDRESS_REQUIREMENTS
member.summary: Specifies a lowest and highest base address and alignment as part of an extended parameter to a function that manages virtual memory.

member.name: MEM_ADDRESS_REQUIREMENTS.LowestStartingAddress
member.summary: Specifies the lowest acceptable address. Calling <a href=" and specifying NULL for LowestStartingAddress, and specifying NULL for LowestStartingAddress, gives the same behavior as calling /.

member.name: MEM_ADDRESS_REQUIREMENTS.HighestEndingAddress
member.summary: Specifies the highest acceptable address (inclusive). This address must not exceed lpMaximumApplicationAddress returned by . Calling <a href=" and specifying NULL for LowestStartingAddress, and specifying NULL for HighestEndingAddress, gives the same behavior as calling /.

member.name: MEM_ADDRESS_REQUIREMENTS.Alignment
member.summary: Specifies power-of-2 alignment. Specifying 0 aligns the returned address on the system allocation granularity.
